channel.title: Images, Videos, scroll, etc... Stops every 1 second for about a half-a-second
channel.description:
Okay I've this problem ever since I got my viruses. I deleted all my viruses, and I still have it. I've gotten rid of it before, even when I have my viruses. The problem is, I get this pause thing for a split second for everything that moves and it pisses me off because it ruins videos for when I try and record, and it just annoys me. Has anyone ever had this problem, or does anyone have any idea how to stop it?
Thanks,
~Lin
[i]Edit: I actually have one virus tbh, an ad-aware one, just spawns popups outta nowhere. I have McAfee delete it once, but it came back. Could that be it?[/i]

item.title: Images, Videos, scroll, etc... Stops every 1 second for about a half-a-second
item.dc:creator: @OnlyOneRule OnlyOneRule
item.description:
@OnlyOneRule wrote:

i have the same probleme, is it the monitor goes black? this is caused by my graphics card because my screen resolution is too high for it to power at times, especially while watching movies

Update:

if it is your graphics card and you have an ATI one go to the Catalyst control center -> Digital Panel Properties -> check the reduce DVI frequency on high resolution displays…

hope it helps

Read full topic
item.source: Images, Videos, scroll, etc... Stops every 1 second for about a half-a-second

item.title: Images, Videos, scroll, etc... Stops every 1 second for about a half-a-second
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

[quote=“exe626, post:18, topic:133779”]Press Ctrl+Atl+Delete, and check your processes. Is there something running in there that shouldn’t be?[/quote]Tbh I go there like 50 times a day removing stuff that I have no idea about. My explorer.exe has been gay, it’s usually at like 80%, and then I got my stuff that’s running, which doesn’t have enough to make it 100%, which it 90% of the time is at.

Hmm I just noticed FireFox is at 2% now, and when I scroll, it goes to 40% and then 60%, when I stop, it goes back down to 2… Right now explorer.exe is at 2%, occasionally goes up to 24 then 40%.

Read full topic
item.source: Images, Videos, scroll, etc... Stops every 1 second for about a half-a-second

item.title: Images, Videos, scroll, etc... Stops every 1 second for about a half-a-second
item.dc:creator: @exe626 exe626
item.description:
@exe626 wrote:

Press Ctrl+Atl+Delete, and check your processes. Is there something running in there that shouldn’t be?

Read full topic
item.source: Images, Videos, scroll, etc... Stops every 1 second for about a half-a-second

item.title: Images, Videos, scroll, etc... Stops every 1 second for about a half-a-second
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

[quote=“o_town_reaper, post:15, topic:133779”]Yeah you need a new video driver because I had the same thing happen to me with my laptop. When I tried to move a window it would move very slow and almost like it was going by frame by frame.[/quote]Mine goes as full speed normally, but every second it stops, but the stop is extremely short.[quote=“therealjdb, post:16, topic:133779”]@Lin do you have a prebuilt computer? if so post the model and make and I’ll do what I can, and it definately sounds like video driver error.[/quote]Idk. The only setting up things I had to do were hook the computer up (not install drivers and stuff).

Read full topic
item.source: Images, Videos, scroll, etc... Stops every 1 second for about a half-a-second

item.title: Images, Videos, scroll, etc... Stops every 1 second for about a half-a-second
item.dc:creator: @therealjdb JDB`
item.description:
@therealjdb wrote:

@Lin do you have a prebuilt computer? if so post the model and make and I’ll do what I can, and it definately sounds like video driver error.

Read full topic
item.source: Images, Videos, scroll, etc... Stops every 1 second for about a half-a-second

item.title: Images, Videos, scroll, etc... Stops every 1 second for about a half-a-second
item.dc:creator: @o_town_reaper o_town_reaper
item.description:
@o_town_reaper wrote:

Yeah you need a new video driver because I had the same thing happen to me with my laptop. When I tried to move a window it would move very slow and almost like it was going by frame by frame.

Read full topic
item.source: Images, Videos, scroll, etc... Stops every 1 second for about a half-a-second

item.title: Images, Videos, scroll, etc... Stops every 1 second for about a half-a-second
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

[quote=“fellixombc, post:13, topic:133779”]safemode > virus scan > virus gone forever[/quote]Ha! That doesn’t work all the time, I’ve done it a bunch of times before I even asked this question.[quote=“o_town_reaper, post:10, topic:133779”]I have had a problem like this when I had to put XP back on my laptop. Maybe the virus deleted your driver to make it scroll up/down smoother.[/quote]It’s not just scrolling, it’s anything that moves.

And to all of you, it’s not from a virus, because I’ve had it when I didn’t have viruses. After they got deleted, though.[quote=“therealjdb, post:7, topic:133779”]Try NOD32, but anyhow if this isn’t resolved by the time I log back on tomorrow I’ll help more but I’m going to bed.[/quote]NOD32 is retarded because it says to uninstall all of your other virus scanners to avoid serious problems, I don’t see what the problem is.

And Idk how to reinstall my video driver, because I never did it.

Read full topic

item.description:
@FastBallz wrote:

therealjdb:

Try to reinstall/install your video drivers. I remember what o_town is talking about and it is kind of similar.

Same, its the video driver. Had this problem after I reformatted.
